page.title: 14Clifton Junction industry(1)
page.content: {Clifton Junction}is an industrial area bounded by the{River Irwell}to the east, the edge of the Clifton Green{housing estate}to the west, the {M62 motorway}to the north and by the {Manchester-Bolton railway}to the south. Most of this area is taken up by {Pilkingtins Tile factory, Chloride {Batteries and Magnesium Electron Ltd. All of these factories back onto the{River Irwell,}which in the days they were built provided a much needed supply of water and also a means of {transport.}The{Manchester-Bolton-Bury {canal}also runs at the back of the factories and this waterway was a most important means of transport when the factories were built, at the end of the{last century.
